title: Twisted Treeline  - Ranked Flex - UPDATED 11th April 2017
body:
UPDATE: Challenger slots have been increase to allow for up to 6 players total.

-------------------------

Hi guys!

So TT Ranked has been a thing for a couple of months now. We're seeing sustained engagement with the queue so I'm happy to announce that for now the queue is here to stay **as long as engagement keeps up**.

We'd like to increase the amount of days per week that TT Ranked can be played to make it easier to engage with the queue on a weekly basis.  Expanding the number of days allows more people access to the queue who may not be able to play on a single given day. 

However, there are real concerns that this could exacerbate queue times - if players are choosing to play on only one particular day, this would reduce the amount of people who are in the queue - particularly towards the beginning and the end of the day. The focusing of players into a shorter period of time is why limited queues are able to sustain themselves when they wouldn't if available 24/7.



-------------------------



We're taking a small step in that direction, by TESTING an expansion of TT Ranked to two nights a week, but reducing the amount of hours that the queue is active per day. Starting this week TT Ranked Flex will be available:
**
Thursday: 5:00pm - 0:00am AEST (7 hours)
Friday: 5:00pm - 0:00am AEST (7 hours)**

In short, total hours that TT Ranked will be available is going up to 14 hours per week, from 10, and 2 nights per week from 1.

Again, this is a test, and any changes may have to be reverted or at least iterated on. We'll keep you up to date if anything changes.


-------------------------


Additionally, due to the tiny amount of players relative to Summoner's Rift, we've had to set a special configuration for Diamond, Master and Challenger tiers in TT Ranked.
How special? Well...

**Since there are so few opportunities to play TT Ranked, we've eased the pressure on decay rates and promo series timeouts at the top of the ladder:**

Challenger & Master tier - Each game played grants 4 "banked" days of no LP decay, up to a maximum of 16 days saved up.
Diamond V - I: The number of days before a promo series expires has been increased to 8.

This effectively means that you are able to miss **one week of ranked TT before decaying in Master/Challenger** and can reach a promo series in Diamond one week and still be able to play it out the week after.

**TT ranks in OCE above Diamond I are now restricted to only allow the following amount of players:**

Master tier - CORRECTION: there is no cap on Master tier. If you can achieve a high enough MMR in the queue, you can break into Master tier.
**UPDATED** Challenger tier - Maximum of **6** players

So, pretty special. There are already 3 Challengers sitting atop the ladder, so get up there and knock them down!

See you on the Treeline.

replies.body:
Curious as to how this is supposed to encourage more people to play. There's currently about 7 competitive 3s players, 4 of us are already at the top of the ladder and another 3 or so which are in diamond 5 or below thanks to getting unlucky placement games. Not only is it a non-incentive for the people who are in the lower rankings trying to climb because the others are effectively 500lp ahead of them already plus promo series luck, but it's also a kick in the nuts to us 4 at the top. We have all played together in some combination to climb to the top so now 1 of us will have to get the short end of the stick. It seems like a lose / lose situation for everyone involved. I understand that the population for OCE is small and that physical rewards from challenger mean that there would have to be some cutbacks in order to maintain fairness and value in the rewards, but why 3 as a number? Surely 6 or 10 would have been a better way to promote competitive games. You could even just do what you did with 5s last season and not give out the physical rewards to everyone in challenger, that worked out well for everyone, it kept the top of the ladder active and competitive and every team played against each other in order to try and secure their spot. If i hadn't started playing 3s and wanted to but saw this, then looked at the ladder, I would definitely not be encouraged to start playing.

edit: since the queue availability update there have been more decent and close games, so that's a good sign. it does appear that most of the people are still struggling to get out of platinum, perhaps you could again (as per my previous suggestion) go the way of 5s and if people have good enough mmr give them the ability to skip division promos (not league promos). It's good seeing more people playing and playing well but i feel like they aren't progressing as fast as they should.{{champion:34}}
There should definitely be more space in the 3v3 challenger ladder for the many talented oceanic players putting in the hard work of climbing and keeping to a strict time frame ranked schedule.

I agree, there are roughly 7 high elo players who actually compete in OCE 3v3. I think 3 is an unfair number as we have all played together and against each other, quite often games are just decided by the matchmaking. I myself am only Diamond 3 in 5v5 solo queue and (currently) plat 1 in 3v3, so I might not have gotten challenger anyway but I'm still speaking up because this is going to be an issue for the competitive 7. Three makes sense because of 3v3, so maybe the best 3v3 team will be the challengers of OCE - but overall this number is too small to fit the competive 7 who all want to be challenger. {{champion:34}}

As someone who is also part of the competitive 7 I find myself agreeing with you. I found myself in silver after some unlucky placements which would have been fine but now there's no incentive to climb the ladder. I'm with my fellow competitive 7 player, Fabulous, here. 7 spots in challenger would make more sense as it would be able to accomodate the competitive 7 who are striving to be challenger. {{champion:34}}

Hi guys, evidently these changes impact some of you quite a bit more than most. I'll try to clarify our stance on this a little.

Why 3 challenger slots?

We want to maintain the status of Challenger as representing the very best in the queue. Given the size of the TT playerbase this was almost impossible. We went with 3 Challenger slots to at least accommodate the standard team size in TT.
Double points Ocean Week encouraged a bunch more players to give TT Ranked a shot. So now the amount of players on the ladder facilitates a total Challenger pool of 3 players quite well.
If the regular Ranked TT playerbase continues to expand, then the amount of Challenger slots will rise.

I was incorrect in saying that Master tier is limited to 9 players, it isn't. If you can achieve a high enough MMR in the queue, you can break into Master tier.

What we won't do is customize the top of the ladder to any individual player's desires or to accommodate a group of friends. This is an objective approach to maintaining the status of Challenger in an extremely low population queue.

--------------------------
On time of day:

The days were expanded to increase the opportunities to play to more than once a week (in terms of days). Players can now miss a day if they need to. The times were condensed for the stated reason that less players in queue at any time means lower quality matchmaking and higher queue times. The current times are strictly based on the most popular times of the day. Unfortunately this does lead to some crappy availability for players who play from WA primarily before 5PM AEDT or at the later hours of the night.

This is hard to solve, as expanding the queue will lead to worse queue times overall and possibly start to hack into match quality.

I've only got a week of data to analyse: so far, slightly more games are being played when compared to the previous schedule, but queue times have increased. 

If the queue could be expanded out slightly to accommodate the western timezone a little better, what would be your preference? The numbers tell me I should expand the queue to start at 4 PM (at first), but this of course simply won't benefit everyone in WA.

We'll assess this option in the near future once we've got a bit more data to run with.
Perhaps adding some sort of IP boost to Twisted Treeline would entice some people to try out the map and maybe join the ranked tt community.

Nice, I haven't played the queue in a couple of weeks because of reasons. (one is my Farewell February, where I am cramming February with playing my WiiU before the Switch comes out)

But I'm happy to see two nights where I can play TT Ranked, especially with how screwed up the weather is making my sleep patterns.

Only having the ranked mode for 3v3 is a mistake. There needs to be normal queue as well. 
Let people pushing ranks play ranked without the interference of people that **just** want to play 3's.
I myself would love to play normal 3's and i get stoked when i see the queue is up, but only having a ranked option turns me off.
I play ARAM or Ascension instead, while having a few drinks after work without messing up someones shot at ranking up.

2 modes and we'd be sweeeeeeeeet as aye :D

Normal TT is available on Tuesday and Wednesday between 3PM and 1AM (the following morning) AEDT. You can find that info in the stickied [queue schedule](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/wgM0WBsO-queue-schedule-updated-feb-8th) thread.

The reason that Normals and Ranked TT aren't run concurrently is because Riot believes (for good reason) that the queues would be unsustainable under such circumstances. Just accept they're on different days and play something else if you're not comfortable with ranked TT when it's up.
Alot of people are only logging in on those days because 3v3s are on, so you could just try having 3s on all the time and just have reduced ranked times like 5s.

That's actually the intent though. Imagine being part of a group of 20 people who really wanna meet up but you all keep going to the meeting place at different times of the week...and just expecting that everyone else will be there when you will. You'll almost always find yourself alone.

It's the same with TT, with so few players willing to meet up for TT, they all need to agree to come together to play at the same time, otherwise they'll never find a match because not enough players at once meet to play.

I don't see how limiting the amount of players in Master and Challenger to such a minuscule amount of players will incentivise people to climb to the top tiers, all it does is solidify the people at the top of the ladder, and prevent people from attempting to break challenger, as a result of the deficit in league points they will face. Not only this, as fellow players of Twisted Treeline Ranked have mentioned, although the queue times have been created to promote flexibility, the limitation on the number of people in the Challenger tier counteracts this idea, with the mindset encouraged being that players should play with the same team every game.

I am also curious how promotions from Diamond I to Master tier will work if Master tier is already filled up. Will the player who won their promotion series merely be unable to move up? Will the lowest player in Master tier be faced with demotion, regardless of the amount of league points they have accumulated, negating their hard work? The banked games and increasing the time frame of the queue is a step in the right direction however, as well as the time you have to complete promotional series. I hope to see an increase to the amount of players allowed in the higher ranks and perhaps further flexibility in queue times, but besides that, these changes are most welcome, especially for the more casual Twisted Treeline players.
Nice.

I'm currently the top ranked player in 3s, have a few concerns.

First one is what Emphasis said. Limiting the number of Challenger spots is unlikely to drive motivation to play the queue mode.  The current top 4 players regularly queue together, and now one of them is going to have to give up the Challenger spot. As far as I know, no other queue type has such a skewed ratio of 3:10. I don't even think there are 200 master tier players in solo queue (when there are 200 spots in Challenger), so it does seem strange to do it this way.

Secondly, if it's due to population density that quantity of challenger spots has to be limited, then it similarly makes no sense for Ranked Flex 5v5 to be able to have 200 spots in Challenger Tier. That queue is even more of a joke than twisted treeline (let's be real guys).

Third, I think the queue should be open for one more hour on both days. The current queue times make it almost impossible for any player who works full time to get more than a few games in within Western Australia due to timezone differences.
why only 1 hours ? more like from 10am to 1 am on both days atleast... its so ragy to play twice a week already...
Casual TT players that have school Thursday and Friday would never get to play this queue though.

Is it possible to see what the current Schedule is for both Ranked and Normal TT?

The most recent Rioter post here still seems to state that Ranked is up Thurs/Fri but I noticed it was actually up last Sat/Sun.
There seemed to be an increased interest last Sat/Sun when the Ranked queue was up. Some friends and I had a blast playing it.
Would love to know the exact current schedule so we can plan around it. Thanks :)

Hi Ivdiv,

The current schedule for all queues is shown here:
https://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/wgM0WBsO-queue-schedule-updated-oct-23rd

I still consider the Sat/Sun TT Ranked Flex hours as in testing, because interest in the queue seems to be fluctuating. Some weekends it looks like we can keep it running for four nights a week, other weekends the amount of games played is so low that I'm considering reducing it to a 2 or 3 day schedule or restricting the hours slightly again.

That being said, I'm glad to hear that you and your mates are having a great time with the mode :)

Why does it have to go down at all? :( Is it possible to have a draft pick norm's on the other days, at the very least then you would get to ban those few annoying champs that are absolutely unstoppable in TT.
Do we have any idea how long it will be before ranked 3v3 gets an extra day?  Or what would need to happen in order for this to occur.

At the moment there are no plans to expand the queue further. It is already stretching to match players optimally even with such a condensed set of hours. Adding an extra day would see queue times increase dramatically and matchmaking quality would take a hit as well.
A few more players might come to play TT on the extra day, but there would still be far less players queuing up at the same time if the option to do so is spread out over three nights rather than two.
test
You have passed the test.
GGH
Hey, i want to play TT Ranked but i cant find it anymore (ranked tt isnt up). Can u please explain and tell me when it will be up again - the scheldure of Ranked TT.
Hey I checked out the queue status from last night and it was available at the right time. If you're not able to see the queue again next time then please try re-logging in.

For me it wasn't showing, and can you please tell me the schedule for the TT ranked, becoz when im on, on the "scheduled times" its not up for me. So yeah, please just reply and tell me when it will be up. Also it did say TT 3v3 in my play menu but there was no ranked one only normals.

> Also it did say TT 3v3 in my play menu but there was no ranked one only normals.

Normal and Ranked TT queues are available on different days, Tuesday and Wednesday for normals and Thursday and Friday for Ranked, so if that occurred on a Tuesday or Wednesday then the queue is working as intended. I feel I should point out that, given the way the queues show up in the "Play" section, Ranked could be mistaken for normals. You can accurately identify which queue it is by jumping into the pre-queue lobby and checking the queue type.
thanks

HeartVine is correct. The TT mode you're seeing on Thurs/Fri is Ranked. If you select it and hit Confirm you'll see the mode type in the top left of the Lobby screen.
The reason it isn't specified on the first screen like SR is because there is only one mode to pick anyway.

It could be made clearer by displaying the "Ranked Flex" option below it even though its the only mode available anyway. I've asked the client dev team about this but it isn't something that can be done at the moment.

thanks, i have played it a lot now, i got a rank in just 2 days...
but i wish it was out for more than 1 day
btw 
there is a really funny and troll bug/glitch - i was playing garen, and when we were taking the nexus i used my e as the game just ended, and when the game ends every player should be invulnerable, but this heimerdinger wasnt, so i killed him when the game ended...

You say you want to encourage play. But you enable TT on most days **Except Weekends**. I don't understand how this is meant to encourage play when some players who only have time on weekends can't even access TT. Please respond.
Its likely because we have RGM on weekends, and OCE isn't big enough to support two kinds of featured queue plus the usual.
looks like its been canned again. Thanks for trying so hard to get it going again. Don't bother reviving it again unless the effort is going to be put in.

Was there a problem with TT on Friday night? At the time of your message the queue had turned off the for day.

There were also very few people playing TT due to ARURF being on.

I realized that the 3 vs 3 que was ranked but it does not state it. There is no difference in the que names and I have seen this as a source of a problem for the mode. People trying out 3's on the ranked nights are unaware that it is ranked and this is impacting the game negatively for  people trying to climb in turn making them act negatively towards the potential player base. Would it be possible to rename the que during ranked hours to minimize this problem?

I think the problem with Thursday and Friday nights tend to be schooling and socialising.
Is there a way to see how many premades there are in normals, because I think you'll find a lot more on Fridays and weekends >_< Which just isn't healthy for a 3v3 queue. 
Plus there's the fact Rito doesn't reward as much for playing in the TT queue and there isn't much support towards it. 
Personally I think it's going to end up like dominion; lost and forgotten.{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}
Can someone from Riot confirm if ranked 3s is happening still or not?

It's Thursday and it isn't up yet. Has it been canned? I don't think it was advertised well as I by chance spotted this thread. It has been years since we lost 3's and I know people that stopped playing or swapped servers to continue playing.
 For all the stats Riot has it doesn't seem to implement them in an optimal way. Surely you could of sent a message similar to the gift received ding, saying TT ranked is up to players who have played over 50 games.

How can a ranked mode with a lot of fun and fullfilment be only available some times.. first of all if people work or what ever during those hours its over for them they cant do anything during whole season.. and this number of master and challenger for thousands i dont know how can it be such little... please enlarge all this at least a bit
cheers

Well those times just knocked a lot of my play time out. between commitments and other things I only really get to play 1 game after 4pm and maybe a game or two before queue closes on Thursday. With it changing to 1700-0000 that means that i have almost no window to play on Thursday or Friday. Which is a massive disappointment since i only really play featured and TT. I haven't played a game of normal or ranked SR in months.

It appears you guys didn't consider the possibility that top players in the ladder could queue up with different players at any point of their climb. If these changes were made towards something such as ranked 5s where different members in the team played but everyone in that team still got that rank then it wouldn't be a huge problem. However as the intelligent and incredibly handsome Emphasis mentioned, there won't ever be a roster of 3 players that only queue up with each other, due to personal reasons or unavailiability on the day. I don't personally play TT but I don't really see any reason to only allow 3 players to only be in challenger. WIth how limited the amount of time you can actually play TT on a weekly basis, not many people would want to play when there are already 4 challengers sitting at a high spot in the ladder.

I dont understand why its not from 10am to 1am ... At the really end what people will think about it. They are killing team ranked and TT. soon it will be full of trash mode only casual plays. And then the final step kill the game and propose to their clients that fed em so hard to go on smartphone games and stop LOL on cpu as they do way more money on phone games and shits like clash of clans etc... who cares about blood moon or nexus siege... and truly 3 slot for 3 people in challenger... when you had 50 teams... lol its fun how you test things. instead of balancing it your killing it. soon no one will remember 3v3 existed cuz of oldest players stopping and new ones playing only blood moon and siege lol... Its only my point of view anyway... but i dont even know why would a ranked mode be available only 14 hours a week... this is on purpose to kill this mode. Just have a look to the first 3 challengers in 3v3 Bma is playing only 3v3 and didnt play a single game since last week. It shows that you need to put 3v3 permanent or more... its totaly crasy decision to do that to a ranked mode. cheers
This shit all over the times I can play this mode.
